div.div: ἐπ-οτρύ̄νω , aor. ἐπώτρῡνα: urge on, move, prompt, impel, τινά, and w. inf., rarely τινί (most of the apparent instances of the dat. depend on some other word), Il. 15.258, Od. 10.531; joined with κελεύω, ἄνωγα, Β 422, Il. 10.130; often θῡμὸς ἐποτρύ̄νει, Il. 6.439; in bad sense, ‘stirred me up,’ Od. 8.185; of things, πόλεμόν τινι, ἀγγελίᾱς πολίεσσι, χ 152, Od. 24.335; mid., ἐποτρῡνώμεθα πομπήν, ‘be quick with our escort,’ Od. 8.31 (cf. act., 30).
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
